Description: Two joining fragments (physically not joined) of rim of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix; white slip; interior: tongue pattern at rim, some black, others with traces of added red; exterior: two bands above triple pomegranate pattern frieze with red dots on the fruit.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This sherd belongs to the same vessel as Boston 88.1076, Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.4.1894 and Oxford AN1896-1908-G.133.8. According to Venit, the painted triple pomegranate band was painted only by the Naukratis Painter.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 38, pl. 23, no. 19a-b)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 395, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.22) (Phase 1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 549, no. E7)
